intro: Kedrostis longepedunculata, commonly known as the long-pedunculate spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its tall, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, which are surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant contains latex, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation.
